definition: knife/blade/single-edged sword/cutlass/CL:把[ba3]/(slang) dollar (loanword)/classifier for sets of one hundred sheets (of paper)/classifier for knife cuts or stabs

sentences.english: I opened it and took a thin blade of blue steel in each hand.
sentences.chinese: 我把它打開，一手捏起一片薄薄的藍鋼刀片。

sentences.english: They stab it with their steely knives.
sentences.chinese: 他們彼此間用鋼刀相互揮刺。

sentences.english: Already ill, this guy went, my chest pierced a steel knife.
sentences.chinese: 本來就在病中，這傢伙又往我心口刺進了一把鋼刀。

sentences.english: Each Bulat blade is labeled with the Master's mark and comes with a certificate of authenticity.
sentences.chinese: 每個布拉特鋼刀片都標有製做者的商標和防僞證書。

sentences.english: Let off tribulations fragile iron filings, a sharp steel knife.
sentences.chinese: 讓磨難打掉脆弱的鐵屑，鑄成鋒利的鋼刀。

sentences.english: The blade will hold its sharp edge much longer than steel knife.
sentences.chinese: 刀片可以比鋼刀更加持久地保持鋒利。

definition: to try out a new product (or manufacturing process)/prototype/trial product
the shaft of a pen or writing brush/pen-holder/pen
made of steel/steel (bar, screw, product etc)
